snippet: For the Whitney Museum’s farewell show at its current building in 2014, it will mount a giant retrospective of Jeff Koons’s work.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Whitney Museum of American Art will present a Jeff Koons retrospective as its final exhibition before moving to its new building in the meatpacking district in 2015; Metropolitan Transportation Authority Arts for Transit has commissioned Chuck Close to create a permanent installation for the 86th Street and Second Avenue station, which is scheduled to open in 2016; Stephane C Connery resigns as director of its private sales at Sotheby's.
lead_paragraph: For the Whitney Museum’s farewell show at its current building in 2014, it will mount a giant retrospective of Jeff Koons’s work.

headline.seo: Jeff Koons Retrospective Coming to Whitney Museum
headline.main: Before Whitney’s Move, a Koons Retrospective
headline.print_headline: Before Whitney’s Move, A Koons Retrospective
